ud3.1:0.2: Born of the Fruits of deeds
ud3.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud3.1:1.3: Now, at that time a certain mendicant was sitting not far from the Buddha, cross-legged, with his body straight. As a result of past deeds, he suffered painful, sharp, severe, and acute feelings, which he endured unbothered, with mindfulness and awareness.
ud3.1:2.1: The Buddha saw him meditating and enduring that pain.
ud3.1:3.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud3.1:4.1: “A mendicant who has left all deeds behind,
ud3.1:4.2: shaking off the dust of past deeds,
